skill.name: deployment-build
skill.description: Knowledge of the Vercel deployment pipeline, hybrid build scripts, and environment configuration for Next.js and Docusaurus applications.
skill.summary: Expert knowledge for deploying Next.js applications with hybrid Docusaurus documentation builds on Vercel.
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: All 37 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate deployment knowledge base containing Vercel build configuration documentation. Analyzer flagged SHA256 content hashes as weak crypto, build commands as shell execution, and env variable names as credential access. No actual malicious code exists.

content.value_statement: Deploying hybrid Next.js and Docusaurus applications requires complex build orchestration. This skill provides the exact commands, environment configuration, and Vercel settings needed for seamless production deployments.
actual_capabilities: Configure Vercel build commands for hybrid Next.js and Docusaurus projects
Set up environment variables for Vercel deployments including API keys
Configure Vercel routing to proxy API requests to Python FastAPI backends
Understand the hybrid build process that copies static docs into Next.js public folder
Deploy Python FastAPI functions alongside Next.js applications
limitations: Does not execute build commands directly in the current project
Does not create or modify vercel.json configuration files
Does not authenticate with Vercel or deploy applications
Specific to the Vercel platform and Next.js/Docusaurus stack

use_cases.title: Set up Vercel environment variables
use_cases.description: Configure the required environment variables in Vercel Dashboard for your deployment including API keys and secrets.
use_cases.target_user: DevOps engineers and developers setting up CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Understand hybrid build process
use_cases.description: Learn how the build command chains Docusaurus and Next.js builds to produce a unified static site.
use_cases.target_user: Full-stack developers working with mixed documentation sites

use_cases.title: Configure API routing
use_cases.description: Set up Vercel rewrites to route API requests from Next.js to a Python FastAPI backend function.
use_cases.target_user: Backend developers integrating Python services with Next.js frontends

prompt_templates.title: Environment setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Which environment variables do I need to configure in the Vercel Dashboard for this deployment?

prompt_templates.title: Backend routing
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I configure Vercel routes to proxy API requests to my Python FastAPI backend?

prompt_templates.title: Build customization
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the complete hybrid build process and how does Docusaurus documentation get integrated into the Next.js public folder?

output_examples.input: What environment variables do I need?
output: Configure these in Vercel Dashboard > Settings > Environment Variables:

output_examples.input: How does the build process work?
output: The build pipeline runs npm run build which executes:
1. cd textbook && npm install && npm run build (Docusaurus docs)
3. npx shx cp -r textbook/build/* public/docs/ (copy static files)

best_practices: Always set environment variables in Vercel Dashboard before deploying to avoid build failures
Configure proper routing rules in vercel.json to handle API proxying to backend functions
Test the hybrid build locally before deploying to catch documentation copy issues early
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in build scripts instead of using environment variables
Skipping the documentation build step which would result in missing docs in production
Not configuring the FastAPI backend route properly causing 404 errors on API endpoints

faq.question: Does this skill execute build commands in my project?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides knowledge about the deployment configuration. You still need to run build commands in your terminal or CI/CD pipeline.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-Vercel deployments?
faq.answer: No. This skill contains specific knowledge for Vercel deployments including vercel.json configuration and Vercel-specific routing.

faq.question: What Python version does the FastAPI backend use?
faq.answer: The skill references Python runtime for FastAPI. Check vercel.json for the specific Python version configuration.

faq.question: How do I deploy the FastAPI backend alongside Next.js?
faq.answer: Configure vercel.json with rewrites that map /api/* requests to the Python function endpoint.

faq.question: What happens if I skip the Docusaurus build step?
faq.answer: The documentation files would not be copied to the Next.js public folder, resulting in missing or broken documentation in production.

faq.question: Do I need all the listed environment variables?
faq.answer: Required variables depend on your application features. GEMINI_API_KEY and BETTER_AUTH_SECRET are typically required for core functionality.
